headline.main: WORRYING ABOUT ULCERS; Most 'remedies' for stomach ulcers have not worked. The patient's only consolation--which does little for the pain-- is that his physician did not know any better.

docs.abstract: Gilbert Cant article revs latest research on ulcers; repts med findings that traditional treatments of antacids, antispasmodics and bland diets are not necessarily helpful; discusses effect of temperament and life style on gastric disorders; drawings (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: A hopeful revolution is taking place in the world of the millions who suffer from ulcers. Radical changes in medical thinking, prompted by the acquisition of fresh knowledge, and Government approval of a medication of an entirely new class combine to give promise of hitherto unattainable relief for the pain-racked victims of the commonest diseases of the stomach and other parts of the upper digestive tract.
